title: Participatory Software Engineering Design Workshop: Language-Based Communication Strategies for Managerial Competency Strengthening

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level knowledge and practical experience in the field, foundational grammar and specialized terminology understanding for technical documentation
context.additional_context: A teaching competency enhancement program for pre-service or in-service teachers, featuring team-based participatory projects in blended (face-to-face/remote) classroom settings using digital tools. Focuses on improving learners’ technical writing and communication skills.

learning_goals: After a 2-week training period, learners will create a Software Requirements Specification (SRS) reflecting user-centered requirements for three types of real-world business scenarios (e.g., finance/medical fields) and submit a document that meets at least four of the five provided evaluation checklist criteria through clear expression and structured text organization in technical documentation.

Learners will collaborate with three or more team members using version control systems like GitHub/GitLab, apply a project management process (branch strategy, code review, issue tracking) incorporating five or more functional requirements within two weeks, and utilize effective communication skills (grammar, vocabulary, contextual understanding).

Learners will design and implement an MVP (Minimum Viable Product) prototype within two weeks using an evolutionary development approach and employ professional technical terminology and precise language in documentation throughout the development phases.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
